summary: The Broadband Grant Tax Treatment Act amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exclude certain broadband grants from gross income. It defines "qualified broadband grants" and specifies various programs under which such grants qualify for this exclusion, including those from the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act and other federal and state programs. The bill also includes provisions to prevent double benefits and outlines an effective date applying to taxable years ending after March 11, 2023.
